name: 旅遊業英語
description: According to the United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO), tourism ranks among the fastest growing industries in the world. This ESP course aims to help students develop their understanding of the tourism business. Topics include travel agency and reservation, transport types, accommodations, vacation packages, SWOT analysis in marketing, and careers in tourism. The course provides authentic materials to strengthen student’s communication skill in a professional context, as well as the ability to interpret charts, tables, and forms. The course aims to meet these objectives through lectures, readings, assignments, and collaborative activities.
goals: Expand on the four skills of language learning
Learn the jargon used in the tourism industry & gain practice in interpreting charts, tables, and forms
Widen global perspective & enhance cross-cultural skills
Instill positive work ethics and spirit of hospitality
syllabus:
**Course description** 

This course aims to help students develop their understanding of the tourism industry. Topics include travel agency and reservation, transport types, accommodations, the airline industry, vacation packages, SWOT analysis in marketing, and careers in tourism. The course provides authentic materials to strengthen student’s communication skill in a professional context, as well as the ability to interpret charts, tables, and forms. The course aims to meet these objectives through lectures, readings, assignments, and collaborative activities.

**Required text**    

Robin Walker & Keith Harding. Oxford English for Careers: Tourism 1. Oxford University Press

**Course requirements** 

1.  Midterm (25%) & Final (30%)    

       2. Assignments (25%) 

           -- Includes promotional presentations, advert brochures, and tourism jobs “infomercial”

       3. Participation & In-class Activities (20%)
